paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Val142Ile, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: predominantly lower limb polyneuropathy without cardiac involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The complete sequencing of the TTR gene resulted in a positive finding for the pathogenic heterozygous variant c.424G>A (p.Val142Ile) missense in the TTR gene, confirming the diagnosis of hereditary amyloidosis associated with transthyretin.

functional_data.summary: The variant is most commonly associated with a cardiac phenotype but can occasionally manifest with polyneuropathy.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic confirmation.
variants.additional_notes: The patient presented an atypical clinical manifestation of the variant.
key_quotes: The clinical genetics service evaluated him and reported that this variant is most commonly associated with a cardiac phenotype.
However, due to its variable expressivity and incomplete penetrance, it can occasionally manifest with polyneuropathy and explain all the patient’s clinical manifestations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was successfully extracted.
